definition: to shatter/to smash/to break into pieces
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to break down/to break into pieces/fragmentary
to do things in bits and pieces (idiom); piecemeal work

sentences.english: Car crash, broken glass, broke my dreaming.
sentences.chinese: 車輛猛撞了，玻璃盡裂，打碎我的夢。

sentences.english: He is in trouble again. This time he has broken a window.
sentences.chinese: 他又有麻煩了，這次他打碎了窗戶上的玻璃。

sentences.english: She reproved the maid in an angry voice for breaking the dish.
sentences.chinese: 她對打碎盤子的女僕大聲叱喝。

sentences.english: He chipped a piece off the edge of the cup.
sentences.chinese: 他把茶杯的邊打碎了一塊。

sentences.english: And he answered and said, Babylon is fallen, is fallen; and all the graven images of her gods he hath broken unto the ground.
sentences.chinese: 傾倒了，他一切雕刻的神像，都打碎於地。

sentences.english: I broke the glass, so I'll pay for it.
sentences.chinese: 玻璃是我打碎的，由我來賠。

sentences.english: Handle the tube carefully , or you will break it .
sentences.chinese: 小心拿住管子，否則會打碎的。

sentences.english: There is a flaw in the dish.
sentences.chinese: 經常打碎盤子是她的一個老毛病。

sentences.english: She dropped the plate and smashed it.
sentences.chinese: 她失手把盤子掉在地上打碎了。

sentences.english: Betty Crocker called for half a cup of chopped walnuts.
sentences.chinese: 《貝蒂妙廚》上要求半杯打碎的核桃仁。

sentences.english: He shall break also the images of Bethshemesh, that is in the land of Egypt; and the houses of the gods of the Egyptians shall he burn with fire.
sentences.chinese: 他必打碎埃及地伯示麥的柱像，用火焚燒神的廟宇。

sentences.english: those who oppose the LORD will be shattered.
sentences.chinese: 與耶和華爭競的，必被打碎。

sentences.english: Mahone smashes the car window with the pipe and he escapes from Wheeler and Lang. They pursue him and Lang catches Mahone at gunpoint.
sentences.chinese: 馬宏用鐵管打碎了車窗，從車裏跳出逃走。

sentences.english: I swept the pieces of the broken jar into the dustpan.
sentences.chinese: 我把打碎的罈子碎片掃進了簸箕裏。

sentences.english: With a clatter, the flatterer shattered the chattering wattmeter in the chaos.
sentences.chinese: 賣啷一聲，馬屁精在雜沓中打碎了格格作響的瓦特表。

sentences.english: I threw it at a bird, and it went straight to the plate.
sentences.chinese: 我拿石頭砸一直小年，但是卻打碎了姐姐的盤子。

definition: to break down/to break into pieces/fragmentary
to destroy in an explosion/to break (by bombing)
to disintegrate/to shatter into small pieces
to scatter/to break sth up/to beat (an egg)
